summary.p: [1] Enzinas would much prefer to speak with Bullinger in person than to disturb him, who is so busy, with a letter. However, he must deliver the enclosed letter addressed to Bernardino Ochino, so that Bullinger can forward it as quickly as possible.
[2] Enzinas will set off for Zurich in three or four days. Then they can discuss everything in detail.
[3] Should letters for Enzinas arrive in Zurich from Basel or other places, Bullinger should keep them. This should also be communicated to Johannes Fries.

div.p: Greetings. I would indeed prefer to speak with you in person rather than trouble you with a letter, as you are already quite busy. However, these letters had to be sent to Bernardino, and I earnestly request that you send them with the first messenger.
I will set off for Zurich in three or four days, where we can discuss all matters more thoroughly in person.
In the meantime, if any letters arrive for me either from Basel or elsewhere, please keep them with you until I come. Please also inform Fries of the same.
Convey my greetings to all the brothers, whom I will see shortly, God willing. Farewell.
To the most distinguished man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, in Zurich.
